snippet: The rebel alliance seized power in March, but clashes with Christian militias and other fighters loyal to the ousted president, François Bozizé, have continued.
abstract: Thousands of Christian civilians in Central African Republic seek refuge at airport guarded by French soldiers, fearing retaliatory attacks by former rebels of mostly Muslim alliance after Christian militias attacked capital of Bangui.
lead_paragraph: The rebel alliance seized power in March, but clashes with Christian militias and other fighters loyal to the ousted president, François Bozizé, have continued.

headline.main: Central African Republic: Civilians Flock to French Troops for Safety
headline.print_headline: Central African Republic: Civilians Flock to French Troops for Safety
